page.title: 01SOUTH CERNEY AREA
page.content: The South Cerney area lies to the west of the A419 Cirencester-Swindon road, 3 miles south west of Cirencester. The area is dominated by the extraction of gravel which has left many large water-filled gravel pits some of which are now used for water sports and fishing. Gravel is still extracted from several pits which generates heavy traffic since all the gravel is moved by road. The farmland in the area is mostly used for grazing cattle but there is some arable land to the north east. The large village of South Cerney has a population of about 2000. It has grown considerably in recent years and is a popular place to live for people who work in Cirencester or commute to Swindon 10 miles away. There is a small village at Cerney Wick.
